events.message: The customer reported an accident involving their car at an intersection with moderate damage to the vehicle's front bumper and headlights.
After reviewing the initial report, the claim was categorised under Auto Accident due to vehicle collision and damages described.
An insurance claims agent was assigned to assist the customer and guide them through the claims process.
The claim was formally acknowledged, and the customer received confirmation along with an outline of next steps.
The claims agent requested copies of the police report, driver's license, and photos of vehicle damages for further processing.
Customer submitted all requested documents, including official police report and multiple photographs clearly showing the car’s damage.
Investigation was initiated to verify claim details and assess the extent of damage on the vehicle from the collision.
The investigation report was completed, confirming the damage assessment and accident circumstances provided by the customer.
Based on evaluation, a fair settlement amount covering repair costs and possible rental reimbursement was proposed to the customer.
Customer responded positively to the settlement offer, expressing appreciation for the efficient and fair claims process.
The claim was officially approved by the insurance company, confirming all settlement terms and authorizing payment.
Payment for the approved claim was issued and sent to the customer’s bank account promptly as per the agreed settlement.
Following payment, the claim was successfully closed with confirmation sent to the customer thanking them for their cooperation.
The claim file was archived in the system for record-keeping and future reference, completing the end-to-end process.
